summary: Lore friendly and realistic modification of the Hjerim house in Windhelm. Not a complete overhaul, but a collection of incremantal additons.
descriptionHtml:
Lore friendly and realistic modification of the Hjerim house in Windhelm (lore friendly = not lore unfriendly, no anime content, etc., realistic = no football stadium sized rooms, no cheats, etc.). Not a complete overhaul, but a collection of incremantal additions to make this house more useful and comfortable to live in - just enough space for books, armors, weapons and enchanting and alchemy materials and even followers.

[b]Versions[/b]
3.3
- One more noble bookshelf in the library.
- Smoking room next to the secret room.
- Navmesh improvements.
3.0
- All forging tools, smelter, a chopping block, and chests for storing raw materials outside the house.
- No longer compatible with Hjerim Home Improvement - Forge and Crafting Tools by Volek.
2.0
- Basement (same cell as the house) with one room for followers.
- A prison cell, where you can keep your argonian follower, if you have one.
1.14:
- Plants in the hall
- More privacy: rooms have doors on the second floor
- Better lighting
1.11:
- Minor improvements.
1.9:
- More than 30 new interactive bookshelves.
- Lots of weapon plaques.
- Weapon racks.
- 13 new mannequins.
- More than enough chests.
- Decorations - minimal.
- A new room - a separate interior cell to workaround the crashes on leaving interior cells with too much objects and loading exterior cells.
Future:
- The basement is the same size as the ground floor, so there is plenty of space for new rooms, or secret rooms, or other secret things.
- Lighting tweaks.
- Better navmesh.
- More bookshelves can be necessary, as there is not enough space for longer series.

[b]Install[/b]
- Finish the Blood on ice quest, buy the house and all improvements - the mod should work without these, but I have not tested.
- Take every object, you want to keep (and dont want to disappear), from the house .
- Go outside, save your game, and than keep that save as a backup .
- Unzip the archive in your game directory.
- Play.

[b]Uninstall[/b]
- Delete the hjerim_home.* files from the data directory.

[b]Compatibility[/b]
- This mod may be incompatible with all mods that alter the interor, or the world area next to the entrance of the Hjerim house.
- Should be compatible with all other mods.

[b]Known issues[/b]
- Sometimes, some of the mannequins leave their place when you enter the house, or load a saved game inside it. Sometimes they don\'t. The [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=10652]Vanilla Mannequin Script Fix by SLuckyD[/url] will solve all issues with mannequins. v1_1 STATUE Version is recommended, as it adds only the fixes, not unrealistic functions.

[b]Highly recommended mods[/b]
I used this as a resource: [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=11618]Modders Resource-Weapon Racks-Bookshelves-Plaques-Mannequins by Eldiabs[/url]
Makes bookshelves useful: [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=10891]Unlimited Bookshelves by da5id2701[/url]
The game doesnt look good without this: [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=7654]Realistic Lighting With Customization by Pluto - 747823 - Leviathan1753 - Sydney666[/url]
Really fixes the mannequins: [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=10652]Vanilla Mannequin Script Fix by SLuckyD[/url]
author: winter_shadow
